briefdescription.para: Enum to be use as a Mode.

detaileddescription.para: The only value provided in this class is ZOOM, indicating that the user is in a mode enabling him to zoom.

briefdescription.para: typedef indicating in wich mode the user is.
Enumeration indicating in wich drawing contents mode the widget is: reuse of the double buffer or redraw the contents into the double buffer.
Object enabling to transform the window which represent the part of the world to be drawn.
Coordinates of the point where the user has first click.
Boolean indicating that the user has double clicked.
Rectangle identifying the selected area.
Mode giving the way of drawing the contents of the view.
Draw mode (selected by the user via a menu, a button or a shortcut).
A cursor to represent the zoom state.
Border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
Boolean indicating if a rubber band has to be drawn while not in ZOOM mode, the default is false.
Boolean indicating if while not in ZOOM mode, the rubber band has to be drawn on whole the height of the window.
Color use to display the legends.

memberdef.argsstring: (int Xborder, int Yborder, QWidget *parent=0, const char *name=0, QColor backgroundColor=Qt::black, int minSize=500, int maxSize=4000, int windowTopLeft=-500, int windowBottomRight=1001, int border=0)
memberdef.name: BaseFrame

briefdescription.para: Constructs the view.

parameterdescription.para: border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
the parent QWidget.
name of the widget (can be used for introspection).
color used as background. Balck is the default.
minumum size of the view.
maximum size of the view.
the top-left corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
bottom-right corner of the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
size of the border between the frame and the contents.

briefdescription.para: Signals that the widget is about to be deleted.
Sets the borders of the frame.

parameterdescription.para: border on the left and right sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).
border on the top and bottom sides inside the window (QRect corresponding to the part of the drawing which will actually be drawn onto the widget).

briefdescription.para: Update the information presented in the view if need it.
Change the current mode, call by a selection of a tool.

parameterdescription.para: new mode of drawing.

briefdescription.para: Draws the contents of the frame.

parameterdescription.para: painter used to draw the contents

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a resize event.

parameterdescription.para: resize event.

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a mouse click.

parameterdescription.para: mouse release event.

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a mouse release.

parameterdescription.para: mouse event.

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a mouse move.

parameterdescription.para: mouse event.

briefdescription.para: The view responds to a double click.

parameterdescription.para: mouse event.

briefdescription.para: Translates a point (vx, vy) on the viewport to a QPoint in the world.

parameterdescription.para: x coordinate of the point in the viewport's coordinates system (relative to the widget).
y coordinate of the point in the viewport's coordinates system (relative to the widget).

simplesect.para: the point on the viewport translated to a point in the world.

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience.

detaileddescription.para:
It behaves essentially like the above function.
point
point with coordinates relative to the widget (viewport).
the point on the viewport translated to a point in the world.

briefdescription.para: Translates a point (wx, wy) in the world to a QPoint on the viewport (relative to the widget).

parameterdescription.para: x coordinate of the point in the world's coordinates system.
y coordinate of the point in the world's coordinates system.

simplesect.para: the point on the world translated to a point in the viewport.

briefdescription.para: This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience.

detaileddescription.para:
It behaves essentially like the above function.
point
point with coordinates in the world.
the point on the world translated to a point in the viewport.

briefdescription.para: Translates the abscissa wx in the world to the abscissa on the viewport (relative to the widget).

parameterdescription.para: abscissa in the world's coordinates system. abscissa in the viewport's coordinates system.

briefdescription.para: Translates the abscissa wy in the world to the abscissa on the viewport (relative to the widget).

parameterdescription.para: ordinate in the world's coordinates system. ordinate in the viewport's coordinates system.

briefdescription.para: Draws the rectangle specifying the select area.
Translates the width width in the world to a width on the viewport (relative to the widget).

parameterdescription.para: width in the world's coordinates system.

simplesect.para: width in the viewport's coordinates system.

briefdescription.para: Translates the height height in the world to a height on the viewport (relative to the widget).

parameterdescription.para: height in the world's coordinates system.

simplesect.para: height in the viewport's coordinates system.

briefdescription.para: Translates the width width on the viewport (relative to the widget) to a width in the world.

parameterdescription.para: width in the world's coordinates system.

simplesect.para: width in the viewport's coordinates system.

briefdescription.para: Translates the height height on the viewport (relative to the widget) to a height in the world.

parameterdescription.para: height in the world's coordinates system.

simplesect.para: height in the viewport's coordinates system.

briefdescription.para: Sets if a rubber band has to be drawn while the mode is not ZOOM, and how it sould be drawn.

parameterdescription.para: true if a rubber band has to be drawn, false otherwise.
true if the rubber band has to be drawn on whole the height of the window, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Frame base class containing the following features:.

listitem.para: zoom in on a zone selected with a rubber band or on a single point.
zoom out to the original size by double clicking.
coordinates conversion between the world's coordinates system and viewport's coordinates system.
coordinates conversion between the viewport's coordinates system and world's coordinates system.
ability to change the background color.

simplesect.para: This class needs the ZoomWindow class (which provides the zooming calculations), and the zoom_cursor.png for the zoom cursor.
